thread.title: Wife drove Mercedes-Benz convertible and splashed cash on jewellery and designer handbags while fraudulently claiming £110,000 in benefits
thread.title_full: Wife drove Mercedes-Benz convertible and splashed cash on jewellery and designer handbags while fraudulently claiming £110,000 in benefits

author: Chris kitching
title: Wife drove Mercedes-Benz convertible and splashed cash on jewellery and designer handbags while fraudulently claiming £110,000 in benefits
text:
Benefits fraudster Stephanie Zeelie on her wedding day (Photo: DWP) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A benefits cheat who fraudulently claimed £110,000 from taxpayers treated herself to the finer things in life as she splashed the cash on high-end goods. 
Photos from a police raid have revealed the luxurious lifestyle that Stephanie Zeelie, 38, enjoyed while she hid her marriage from officials to cheat the system. 
When police arrived at her home in Cobham, Surrey, they found Porsche and Mercedes-Benz CLK cars parked outside, while a search uncovered luxury items including wallets and handbags made by Prada and Chanel, watches, earrings and other jewellery. 
Zeelie claimed a combined £110,411 in housing benefit, council tax benefit and other benefits, but has been spared jail after pleading guilty. Some of the watches found at Zeelie's home (Photo: DWP) A Chanel wallet found during a police raid (Photo: DWP) Photos of Zeelie's beach wedding in South Africa (Photo: DWP) This sign was found on a door at the property in Surrey (Photo: DWP) 
At Guildford Crown Court this week Zeelie received a 12-month prison sentence, suspended for two years, plus a six-month probation order. Read More White woman who pretended to be black 'living off benefits years after scandal as no-one will hire her' 
She was ordered to complete 100 hours of unpaid work and repay the amount in full. 
The Department for Work and Pensions said Zeelie was investigated for benefit fraud following a tip off from someone who claimed that she always looked good, had nice jewellery and drove a Mercedes convertible. A Prada bag found by police (Photo: DWP) Zeelie claimed £110,411 in benefits while hiding her marriage (Photo: DWP) The 38-year-old received a 12-month prison sentence, suspended for two years (Photo: DWP) Zeelie was investigated for benefit fraud following a tip off (Photo: DWP) 
During a search of her home - which had a "No riff raff" sign - police and DWP investigators also found a hot tub with a built-in TV and sound system and extensive evidence of an ongoing relationship with her husband. 
Detectives found photos from their beach wedding in South Africa and plans for an intimate Valentine's Day, featuring their hot tub, chilled Champagne and steak and chips. Zeelie splashed the cash on luxury items such as handbags (Photo: DWP) An expensive Louis Vuitton bag (Photo: DWP) A piece of art displayed at the property (Photo: DWP) A view of Zeelie's garden, where she had a hot tub with a built-in TV (Photo: DWP) Read More Fury as MoD scheme to give disabled war veterans hi-tech limbs is cancelled THREE times 
A DWP spokesman said: “Only a small minority of people try to cheat the benefits system, but cases like this show how we are rooting out those who are stealing taxpayers’ money and diverting it away from the people who really need it. 
“People convicted of fraud shouldn’t be able to benefit from their crimes, so we will always try to get back the money they stole.” Like us on Facebook
